You actually should be more concerned for the behaviors your child displays in public vs those they do in private.
It's good for children to learn early that there is a time and a place for everything, for example this kid may rough house with his siblings at home but it doesn't give him lead way to sweep kick another kid on the pitch.
I'd be super worried about my kids behavior on the pitch...why wouldn't you be?

That's an awful lot of stuff to write for someone who can't read
Wow what a turd. You never explained how or why it would benefit you for them to do that and your reason is bull.
We already have a way to make gold and items...by playing the game. There is no reason to go back to the AH and it would be to your detriment if we did. The billions of gold you have now and the top tier gear would be impossible to get without a hefty grind or shelling out some real dough.
You're saying if we made the game harder for you it would be better for you because it would be...easier for you to make gold and items by making it harder to get gold and items?
Not only are you pretentious you're apparently retarded too.

No they don't.
Standing in the middle of a highway is much different than using a cross walk at a stop light.
You're just wrong man, admit it and move on. Stop trying, you're not gonna get it.
If you stand somewhere really dangerous that would cause direct harm to you and you do it willingly then you fall under my definition of dumb.

How would it be a boon for you?
With the normal loot pace (let's assume you're talking about around the time people farmed Arreat Crater for legendaries) you're talking about getting a max of twenty legends an hour, more if you're real lucky. Consider all the legendaries that are now implemented in the game and how they affect many different build s and play styles. Upping the drop rate brought more people to the game the only people who would benefit off an AH by your terms would be hard core dedicated players or people with money.
And it was bullshit that back in the day I couldn't ever dream of reaching MP10 without either giving up more cash for gear, farming a ton of gold, or farming the gear myself...all these alternatives take tons of time and only benefited those with time and money.
No, as someone who has been poor and broke and played since the days of the AH I'm going to be rude and say you're very very stupid for thinking the AH would be a good thing ever in any context now for Diablo 3.

Maybe you don't understand the point of my post. I can't say who deserves what that is a matter of subjective opinion. I was trying to point out to you it's not a matter of whether they deserve it or not but the context in which they got hit...which was being dumb and protesting in the middle of a highway.
We can argue all day long about whether they deserve it or not but the fact of the matter is they put themselves into a situation to have this happen to them.
Do they deserve it? I honestly can't say I could see both the yes and no sides of that question.
But I don't care that they did/didn't deserve it, I care that people are stupid enough to stand in the middle of a busy road and then people want to act all surprised or indignant when someone gets hit. Pointing out how idiotic this is rather than arguing about whether they deserve to be hit is more productive to the actual conversation rather than determining dues.
If people think they can garner sympathy for doing this then they will keep doing it, we need to let people know we don't care they should follow the rules simply for safety.
I'm not misquoting you I was being sarcastic. Maybe not literally surrounded but the dude had 10+ people bearing down towards his car, for all intents and purposes we can say the dude was surrounded.
Yea, believe it or not one can have an opinion that someone is dumb and led themselves into a situation but still feel some amount of pity for them.

"NO ONE WAS ATTACKING THE DRIVER GUYS HE WAS JUST SURROUNDED BY AN ANGRY MOB PUSHING AND BEATING ON HIS CAR HE WAS TOTALLY SAY."
You're a fucking trip man.

Would you wait patiently in your car for the police to help you if you were surrounded by an angry mob intent on possibly hurting you or would you fight or flight instinct kick in and nail the gas pedal to get the hell out of there?
You don't have to answer because you and I both know it's the latter.
Running over and hurting people isn't good but you can't possibly think the people in the high way had any right to be there. There is a reason we don't let people just walk all over high ways and dangerous areas.
If someone gets hit by the subway for standing on the tracks are you going to be mad at the conductor for not stopping?
This situation is clear and cut: Don't stand in the middle of the highway and you won't get hit by cars. Bonus points if you can avoid acting like a barbarian and trying to assault people while doing it.

Life has consequence.
If you stand in the middle of the high way you're bound to get hit by a car and the law won't be there to protect you because it's not a pedestrian zone. We can argue over whether they deserve it or not but the objective facts are
1. you're on a high way
2. there are cars on the highway
3. cars can hit and seriously hurt/kill people
These factors added together make it more likely they are going to get hit by being in that position and we cannot simply have sympathy for people who purposefully and idiotically get in the way of others and progress.
It sucks they got run over and I hope they are ok but it's not surprising in the least...what did they think was going to happen?
Play with the bull get the horns as they say.

Ok well you get out of your car and face the angry crowd, slap some people about.
We have rules and regulations for a reason and one of those is YOU DON'T STAND ON THE HIGHWAY.
You're liable to be hit if you're on the high way and if you're being a cunt and blocking it you're at fault for being hit.
Pedestrians only have the right of way in pre-determined pedestrian crossing areas.
If there is no consequence for your action then people are doomed to repeat. I for one and glad that person ran through the crowd because idiots need to learn how to actually protest and not hold up the lives of others in the process.
Do you think it would be right of them to block the high and an emergency vehicle carrying someone on the brink of death can't get through because a bunch of retards are standing in the middle of the road?
People who act like cunts and play with guns will get shot, people who act like cunts and drive will get in wrecks, and people who act like cunts and stand in the middle of the high way will get run over. That's not opinion that is truth.
It's not a matter of who deserves what it's the logical matter of what will happen if you commit to these actions and in this case standing in the middle of the highway...surprise...gets you run over by angry drivers.

A single player mod for Diablo II that enables instant respecs and infinite storage space as well as an increased inventory size. It's compatible with a few other mods not Median at the moment but the 1.13c version of Median and PlugY can work together.

This is what the cube is for. You can re-roll an extra legendary of the same kind to get the stats you want before gifting it.
This is just another way to hold players hands on their way to perfect stats.
This in my opinion is what set Diablo II apart from Diablo III. In Diablo II when you got your high end gear it felt really special and powerful. In Diablo III everyone gets super high end gear really quick and the game becomes about perfecting that gear. We're losing the lust of the loot hunt and it's turning into more of a numbers game.
More often than not the moves aren't choreographed either. Most matches are planned on the fly sometimes five minutes before the match.
Depends on the intersection and which way you're turning.
PlugY
